isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - AUXILIARY DRIVE GEAR

step1.para: Remove the bolts that fasten the bearing retainer of the auxiliary drive gear to the transmission case ( Figure 52).
Remove and discard the snap ring that fastens the auxiliary drive gear to the mainshaft ( Figure 52).

If a two-piece retainer is used for the auxiliary drive gear, use pry bars to separate the auxiliary drive gear from the mainshaft. Remove the gear. Remove and discard the O-rings from the gear. Remove the two-piece retainer (Figure 53).

figure.caption: Figure 53. Separate Auxiliary Drive Gear From Mainshaft

step1.para: If a round retainer is used for the auxiliary drive gear, clean the puller holes and install a 3/8 inch -16 x 1.00 inch bolt in the three puller holes in the bearing retainer of the auxiliary drive gear. Evenly tighten the three bolts to remove the auxiliary drive gear from the mainshaft. If necessary, tap on the mainshaft with a rubber or plastic mallet to separate the gear from the mainshaft. Remove the round retainer (Figure 54).

figure.caption: Figure 54. Install Bolts in Puller Holes

note.para: The ball bearing assembly for the auxiliary drive gear will sometimes come out when the auxiliary drive gear is removed. If necessary, pull on the assembly to separate the gear from the bearing.

step1.para: Put a pry bar under the snap ring on the ball bearing assembly for the auxiliary drive gear. Remove the bearing (Figure 55).
Remove the auxiliary drive gear thrust washer from the mainshaft ( Figure 56).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Put Pry Bar Under Snap Ring
Figure 56. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear Thrust Washer
